summary: Demo uses claude -p with explicit tool-call prompts for deterministic behavior
context: Building a live demo video infrastructure for the 2-Agent Handoff narrative. Need each act to reliably produce specific Twining tool calls with exact parameters.
rationale: Each claude -p prompt explicitly lists the tool calls and parameters the agent should execute. This ensures deterministic, reproducible demo runs — the agent doesn't need to reason about what to do, it just executes the prescribed calls. The alternative of letting the agent explore freely would produce inconsistent results across recordings.

alternatives.option: Let agents explore freely with open-ended prompts
alternatives.reason_rejected: Non-deterministic — each run would produce different findings, decisions, and graph entries, making recording unpredictable

alternatives.option: Pre-populate .twining/ state directly without running agents
alternatives.reason_rejected: Loses the live demonstration aspect — the whole point is showing agents interacting with Twining tools in real time
